Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - I submitted a review last week and it has been deleted, why?”
Reviews.Author: Th0masinaf0g0larta
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel which I submitted a review about last week. It has been deleted and I would like to know why? The staff are excellent, the rooms are clean and it is safe.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: Christina1202
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at my share of hotels and hostels throughout Europe, and Atlanta Frochot is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The staff didn't even try to make us feel welcome, as they spoke very little English and didn't take the time to give us suggestions on sightseeing/places to eat/things to do. They didn't ask for our passports/ids upon arrival so anyone could have checked in/entered without being questioned. The hotel rooms were small, dirty and smelly (I stayed in a room with 1 full bed). My boyfriend woke up with bug bites after sleeping in the bed, and as we were checking out, another American guest was yelling at the front desk that there were bugs in her bathroom and that they couldn't even shower, and the front desk wouldn't change their room! The room was so small that you couldn't walk around the bed without hitting the window, and the water in the shower actually stopped working mid-way through my ice cold/steaming hot shower. The only positive was that the hotel was within a 2 minute walk to Pigalle metro stop, but I would highly recommend booking elsewhere to avoid this terrible experience..I'd even recommend a hostel over Atlanta Frochot!

Reviews.Title: “Good location if your not uptight :)”
Reviews.Author: Kman773
Reviews.Content: Located in Pigalle (red light district) this hotel is just 50m from Pigalle metro stop. The hotel is in the red light, but you have no worries, this is a heavy tourist area packed with locals also. The staff spoke english and was very friendly and helpful. Small contintental breakfast of just rolls and jam w/coffee and juice. Wifi is avail for a fee. My room was small but comfy and clean with a view of small courtyard. It was a great value and the location was good with shops and cafes everywhere and the metro stop just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Steph899
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple and stayed here in Oct 2011 it is a great location, didnt feel threatened being in the red light district, wasnt seedy at all. It is 10 steps away from Pigalle Metro station which will take you everywhere around Paris in no more than 20 mins. The hotel was average if you are not someone with stupidly high expectations. It was clean and friendly, room was small ish, but certainly big enough for a couple. Perfect place and would stay here again. We didnt find it so noisy that we werent able to sleep as some of the other reviews state. It was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Neostream
Reviews.Content: The little hotel is comfortable enough and lovely. Front desk staff was very friendly and spoke English well. The room was small and basic but immaculate with twin comfy beds. Breakfast was fine. Simple - bread, croissants, tea, coffee not a buffet. Great location in the middle of Montmartre, close to the Pigalle metro station (50 m) which has both east-west and north-south metro lines going through it, convenient for exploring Paris. Although located in the red light area we never felt worried about getting to and from the metro. Moulin Rouge it's only 3 minutes away. Our stay was extremely pleasant here and we would recommend it if you are there to enjoy Paris and not to spend time in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: RomaRestaurant
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights in July 2011. It is very basic and to me it was more like an Inn than a hotel. Put it this way: I prefer our Travelodge than this place. It was clean i have to say. Tried the breakfast as part of the deal and found a little fly in the tea cup. The towels and bed sheets were changed daily. A little shampoo and a shoe shinner was in the bathroom. The taps in the bathroom were not in a good condition and i went through a chinese water torture all night. Location wise it is in north of Paris 200 yards away from mulin Rouge. I did not find the reeption very helpful but maybe i should have taken my French lessons more seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant stay close to underground, SacrÃ©-CÅ“ur, shops, restaurants and markets”
Reviews.Author: mbcoolj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum for 2 nights. We were both happy with the service as we'd heard many horror stories of bad service in Paris. The staff were always courteous, informative and friendly. A simple breakfast of croissants, bread and jam, coffee and OJ was served each day and there are lots of leaflets and maps in the hotel. Room facilities were simple and functional. Bathroom smelled a little a times but the TV was awesome quality. We stayed in room no. 60 which was spacious and quiet. No view as it looked out onto another building but we were happy with that. The hotel is on a street with what seemed like 'brothel' bars and sex shops but we felt safe. It's 1 minute walk from Pigalle underground which was very convenient as we used this everyday to get to and from everywhere. Overall it was great value for a good hotel. Paris can really be touch and go but I would definitely stay here again if I were on the same budget (less than 100euros a night) and it's better value if you book it through the Eurostar website. One thing: BE WARNED! Pickpockets are everywhere in Paris and though we were not robbed, we were approached every day by pickpockets. People pretending to be deaf and asking you to sign paper on a clipboard are out to rob you. They do not work for charities. On our 2nd day we saw 4 youths continuously walking closely behind tourists trying to steal. It was upsetting to witness as there is little you can do. We told staff who worked in the tourist places but they didn't seem to care. Probably because they see it everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Booked 5,Stayed ONE !”
Reviews.Author: RoozbeH
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 5 nights but left the hotel first thing next morning, the staff were very friendly the lady speaks couple of languages so it's no problem communicating and the hotel rooms were cheap 65 euros ~100 $ ( cheap in Parisian Standard!!) but the trouble started showing up, the single room was very very small and the windows opened in the back of the building,i was asked to pay 2euros for the safe box per night,which didn't work but offcourse they wiped it off my bill later ,but i needed it ! walls are so thin so there were some people makng some noise next door (not hotels fault) but i couldn't sleep,but the worst part is the location, it's the red light district(that's not a problem itself) the problem is that some guys try to pull you into creepy night clubs and i heard that u will be ripped off with a very huge bill and there were some gangs on the street so the ystart beating each other so i wasn't comfortable at all and didn't feel safe in the area , so i ran away first thing the next morning,but if your ok with dangerous neighbourhoods the transportation is convinient because there's a metro station 100 yards from the hotel so you can go every where

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for your trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pictureseer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in Pigalle with transport links no more than 25 yards away, but in the rooms you wouldn't know it. Metro, bus and taxis are readily available. A short walk takes you to the Moulin Rouge in one direction and the Basilica Sacra Coeur in the other. The staff at the hotel were friendliness personified. I speak very little French, but managed quite well as the day staff spoke English. The evening staff spoke little English, but with my little French we go on very well. Buses run from there to the Louvre and Notre Dame, there is a little road train that will take you to Sacra Coeur, and there is the metro. Many of the restaurants in the area have menus in French and English, and the staff speak a little English too. To be so handy to everything the price was value for money. My wife and I recommend this hotel very strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetence all around”
Reviews.Author: ogopo
Reviews.Content: Positives: location, cleaning staff were nice and did a great job Negatives: Customer service is terrible. I think to explain this comment, I need to say my story. My boyfriend and I booked two nights at Atlanta Frochot on Hotwire. In the confirmation, it stated that the booking included complimentary breakfast. We arrived at the hotel. They told us there was no breakfast and that it was 9euros each per day. Of course, this was unacceptable. They said that it was not their problem because they use a booking agency and the booking agency confirmed that no breakfast was to be included. Of course, for them, the customer is not always right. They were not willing to do anything for us. All I was asking from them in the end was some sort of confirmation that we did not receive breakfast, or the contact information of the booking agency that they used, and they refused!! Finally, I called Hotwire (at my own charge) and they tried contacting the hotel and the guy at the front desk simply told the person that it's not his job to confirm that we did not have breakfast. All sorts of other little things happened in regards to the attitude of the front desk personnel. They would completely ignore us for extended periods of time while we would be waiting to get our room key. Also they would talk badly about us in other languages to other people around, as though we were the cause of the problem. On top of all this, as we were trying to check into the hotel, there were a pair of ladies who had made a booking through a travel agent and it turns out that the hotel "did not receive the confirmation" from the booking agency and so they did not have a room for them. And they refused to do anything to help them. All I can say is steer clear of this place. There is no shortage of accommodation in Montmarte.

Reviews.Title: “Not again unless it was the only one with rooms in my price range.”
Reviews.Author: Danedri
Reviews.Content: The location -- Super close to a metro station and therefore minutes from everything you want to see in Paris. There are also plenty of restaurants, a pharmacy, a few grocery stores nearby. Unfortunately, the everything else nearby is inappropriate for children. It's the reddest red light district I've ever seen. It just goes on and on and on for blocks of filth and porn. I never felt unsafe, but I was afraid to talk to anyone I saw for fear they were perverts. And I wouldn't go out on the street without my husband. Period. He went out alone once and was propositioned. The negatives -- Again -- it's in the red light district, which was kind of silly to us, but the glare of the red lights got old after the second night. (We booked for four nights.) The hotel staff requests your room key every time you leave the building. Um, that's weird. They said they only had one key and if we lost it, we wouldn't be able to get back into our rooms, so they request that guests leave the key at the desk. I didn't like that much for security reasons. The wireless Internet access is expensive and unreliable. We ended up going to the nearby McDonald's to use their free Internet. Our room appeared clean upon first inspection, but it was surface only. Upon closer inspection, everything was dirtier than it appeared. For example, there were hairs stuck to the walls above eye level in the shower. Grossest of all, I picked up the phone one day and the underside of the reciever was covered with what appeared to be earwax. Ewww. Our room faced directly into neighboring apartment buildings, and there was no way to leave the windows open without leaving the curtains open. Also, the residents of neighboring buildings were REALLY loud -- playing awful music at high decibels during all hours of the night and occassionally, just hollering out the window, I guess for fun. This was the only time I've ever stayed in Paris, so I don't have anything to compare that hotel to. But I would try something else next time and hope for the best. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless it was the only thing available in that price range.

Reviews.Title: “good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: riddrie
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for four nights.found staff very helpfull and room was small but clean. even though this hotel is in red light district felt safe.it is also very central for metro and connections for airport.alan watson from glasgow.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh la la....it's the Red Light District....Oh my gawd!!!”
Reviews.Author: dragonflywhispers
Reviews.Content: Firstly please note that this hotel is tucked neatly in between sex clubs and sex shops. My sister and I stayed here for about 4 nights and it was good for a laugh. Our room had a lovely view of a sex/strip club across the road called 'Dirty Dicks'.....LOL. The hotel itself is old and in need of some TLC....the room was really small but cosy. The location is the best feature....a short walk to shops and Metro During my stay here I did the Disneyland Paris tour....the hotel organised it for me and I thoroughly recommend it. . Even though it is a seedy side of town....I felt safe and had no problems. The beggers can be annoying though...just keep walking and don't give money or else you will be swarmed by other homeless beggers.

Reviews.Title: “Good European Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caycay_can
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and was good value for money in an expensive European city. The hotel is very close to both local (metro) and regional (train) transportation. Breakfast was basic, but included. Although there are ``exotic`` bars and shops in the immediate area, also within a few blocks walk are many good boutiques, restaurants and bakeries, the majority of which are unique to the area and offer a true Parisian experience. Laundry, grocery and internet services are also close by. If you`re looking to re-create a North American hotels, this probably isn`t the place to stay. Rooms are small, and only offer limited TV services. However, this is a great base to explore Paris and the surrounding region from, and the hotel offers great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This filthy hotel should be one star hotel!!! Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Triorio
Reviews.Content: It is THE WORST hotel I ever stayed in my life! Room at first floor was so noisy! My bed was shaking while metro train was running under. Then was noise from delivery and workers who were listening radio news!!! Smell of spoiled milk is everywhere! (I wish you never had such bad experience) Your bed. You will feel EVERY coil under in your bed! No pillows, just two rolls seemed to me made from the stone. Everythig is so outdated. Size of the room... It is about 1/4 from size of the room of Motel 6. I do not understand how Hotwire which is assuring you that they are working with only best hotels and brand names could sell such a filthy hotel?! I do not understand how french authority are giving 3 stars for such a terrible place. Booked 3 nights and left after four hours sleeping of first night. Lost about $180 for remaining nights. I have STRONG feeling that the majority of positive responses have been forged by owners of that "hotel" Modest room of Motel 6 looks like president suite after!!! Wireless internet cost 10 euro/hour or 24 euro/day Shame on Hotwire for cheating customers!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, horrible room”
Reviews.Author: dohadiverdiva
Reviews.Content: Good points - the hotel was fairly inexpensive, and kept reasonably clean, although a total facelift would help. The hotel is in a good location, very close to the Metro and good for Montmartre area. If you're feeling energetic it's a downhill 20 -30 min walk to the Louvre. The hotel is in the Pigalle area, which is the red-light district, so be prepared to see the ladies of the night outside the bars close to the hotel. Breakfast is basic but adequate, and the hotel night receptionist was a lovely old lady, who even brought me some juice and a croissant while I was waiting for my taxi to go to the airport at a ridiculous time of the morning. Bad points - The rooms. I was in a single room which had the narrowest single bed I've ever encountered and no pillow, just some kind of narrow bolster fixed to the headboard which was really uncomfortable. The room looked out into a space between the hotel and the building next to it. As there was no aircon and it was the middle of the summer I kept the window open at night - as did the people living in a flat nearby because you could hear everything. Also the 'neighbors' seemed to cook their evening meal just after I'd gone to bed every night and the stench of frying oil and garlic was overpowering. I don't think I would stay there again, despite the good location.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, with interesting neighbours”
Reviews.Author: Kilguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights of my 10 night stay in Paris; I found it to a great value for the money. The area is really interesting (never seen so many sex shops in my life). Despite that fact it is an extremely good location close to all that Paris has to offer, and the Metro station is literally twenty steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre in a special neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PilsnerDk
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the hotel standard in Paris is simply low, but this hotel isn't one I would recommend. The first impression you get is that you've arrived in a Red Light district, with sex shops everywhere, and prostitutes hanging out in bars (and sometimes on the street) 10 meters from the entrance to the hotel. The area didn't seem downright shady, and we weren't annoyed or harassed by anyone (although I was called on by some women), but visitors should be prepared for this. Not very romantic for sure, although there were some nice restaurants at Place Pigalle. Metro station just nearby, which was good. The nearby major road, Boulevard de Clichy was not interesting, just mostly sex shops. The hotel was old-fashioned, and the room was very small and with a view towards a wall / garbage bins. The bed was alright, but nothing special. Tiny standard 14" CRT TV mounted just below the ceiling. The bathroom was poor; small and old-fashioned with just one sink, a toilet and a small half-size bathtub. Only a bit of body lotion, soap and (for some reason) loads of shoe polish was replenished every day. The rooms got cleaned fine, though. Breakfast was served at your table as you came down, and consisted of a standard selection of a bit of bread and pastry, along with coffee/tea/juice. Nothing special about it, but enough to get full for a normal person.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: tylatalor
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel with my four children for three nights in late December - one twin room, one double. Arriving very tired and jet lagged at 6am the staff were most accomodating with a day room(at no charge) and breakfast (basic but friendly). The hotel in a noisy location, which we found to be great fun - and we always felt safe. The metro in 100m and the Gare du Nord about 1km.Montmatre just a stroll up the road.The rooms are small but clean, everything worked, and the staff are friendly - recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Colourful stay at the Atlanta Frochot”
Reviews.Author: hamlettphil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlanta Frochot in the week leading up to Christmas and found it very clean and accommidating. This hotel is in a fantastic location, no more than a 100 pace from Moulin Rouge, and a short walk to Sacre Coer. The hotel is over the road from Pigalle metro station, and has many restaurants and shops nearby for snacks. The hotel room was very basic but clean and tidy, and the maid came every day. Only english speaking TV channel was BBC World News. The staff all speak good english, and you are always greeted with a smile. Breakfast in the morning is very basic, bread and jam and a hot drink, so dont expect much more. Watch out those who are a little prudish, there are lap dancing bars and sex shops everywhere near this hotel, and we were approached on a few occasions by pimps! But it never felt sinister or seedy around this hotel. In all, really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better in the price range”
Reviews.Author: Dial999
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is bread, croissants, jams, butter, tea, coffee, juice served by pleasant staff in lovely breakfast room. If you want bacon, egg, sausage etc, go and pay for it somewhere else, just don't whinge here. Rooms - ours faced the back, which in most major European cities is viewless and staring at a wall. Front rooms face the street, but come with more noise. Take your pick, you can't have both and still be a short walk or a few metro stops to all the best in Paris. Cleanliness was unsurpassed as hotel carpets have just been renewed and cleaner was very efficient. Bed was comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful. No aircon. If I wanted it, I would have paid more for another hotel. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but VERY clean”
Reviews.Author: swissmade
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by the airline website when I booked a ticket from Rome to Paris. As a single male traveller I had booked a single room, which in hindsight was probably a mistake. My first first night was spent in a tiny, single room (single bed) at the front of the hotel, very noisy and overlooking a brothel over the road! The very helpful lady at the front desk shifted me to a double room (it's worth paying slightly more for the extra space) at the back of the hotel which was perfect - light, slightly more spacious and quiet. The hotel is exceptionally clean â€“ so much so that I mentioned it to the front desk so I could leave a tip for the cleaner, Therese, who did an excellent job in keeping the room and bathroom spotlessly clean. For the price and location, I'd recommend this hotel for a short, affordable Paris stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very basic, but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helena_Parker
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Paris, I stayed in the same area first time, just 1 block away, since it is very central and safe (never mind the fact that this is Red Light District - still very safe, and I am a solo traveller - young female). The location is great - near Pigalle metro station, which serves 2 metro lines. Bus stop is also there, takes you to Gare du Nord (if you come by Eurostar) within 5-7 minutes, it is quicker and more convenient than metro for Gare du Nord, since the bus is direct, but if you go by metro - you need to change the metro lines, which can be very tiring, if you have heavy luggage, since most of the metro stations don't have escalator, so, being a Londoner, I assumed there would be lifts/escalators (they have lots and lots of steps, so dragging your suitcase is a nightmare!), and deeply regret my metro journey to the hotel - should have caught the bus - quicker and much more comfortable. The rooms a extremely small and basic (which I expected after reading other reviews), however clean. The staff of the hotel is polite, but the night shift guy was not helpful at all. I didn't like the fact that they don't have bath tubs in single rooms, and they couldn't move me to another room saying they were fully booked. The view from my window was plain cracked grey wall of the next house, couple of meters away, but I was not too bothered, since I didn't come to Paris to stare through my window. The noise level is very high, you have a feeling that there are no walls at all, they are extremely thin - you can hear every breath (not only every word) of guests passing through your room as well as staff talking and cleaning, in fact, staff were always waking me up by noisy talking and banging the doors in the nearby rooms, which was quite upsetting. The breakfast is very poor and plain - you can have only tea/coffee/hot chocolate/grapefruit or orange juice and 3 buns (not more or less, exactly 3 every morning) - one being croissant, another - plain bread bun and third - chocolate bun. You may have jam with it, and occasionally honey. It was very boring and plain breakfast. They serve breakfast between 7am and 10am. One day during my 3 days saty the elevator broke, so guests due to check-out (it is 6 storey building!) had to drag the suitcases via staircase (which is very uncomfortable, see the image of staircase!), it was fixed quite a few hours later. On my last night in Paris I booked Moulin Rouge show directly in the hotel (89 euro) and enjoyed it a lot, walked back to the hotel after the show alone - at 1am - still not scary, the area is very safe and quiet (really!), if you are a solo female traveller like myself, you just need to ignore, if anyone starts talking to you (some sex shops sales people, etc). I would recommend this hotel to tourists on budget, who is not too fussy, who comes to spend time in Paris, not in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean - interesting location!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa_visitor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic but clean and the staff are friendly. The room was small but functional and ours had no bath but it did have a shower. The location is a bit unnerving at first being metres from the Pigalle Metro station (which rumbles underneath the hotel at night; this however did not disturb us). It has a 24 hour reception. Pigalle is the red-light area with numerous but relatively discrete adult shops only metres from the hotel - lots of neon but nothing on display. You would be concerned if you had younger children - too many explanations required! The Pigalle area however is definitely not threatening. Montmartre is about 2 mins away across the Boulevard de Clichy - interestingly, the only 'lady of the night' we saw was actually in Montmartre. The Sacre Coeur is about 10 mins walk but involves many arduous steps. Drinks are very expensive in the Place du Tertre (the pretty square) in Montmartre - a tonic for our vodka was 8 Euro (the vodka only 6 Euro). Great area though - we'd stay at the hotel again. 15 mins easy walk from Gare du Nord. Easy walk also to the Boulevard Haussmann (for the shops).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Internationaljs
Reviews.Content: My sister and I travelled to Paris in early February for her first visit to the City of light. The hotel was reasonable for the price, considering we booked the night before. Highlights: * Fantastic location close to Pigalle metro station (500 meters) making it easy to get around Paris. You could easily walk up to Monmarte for a weekend breakfast at a cafe, and we also enjoyed a pleasant walk down to the Louvre (stopping at Gallerie Lafayette for a bit of shopping. * Room was small as expected, but comfortable, with a reasonable bathroom. * If you stood on one of the beds, you could see the top of the eiffel tower from the window - among the rooftops! Lowlights: * Breakfast isn't that exciting. Just bread based really - not a full continental set up. * The hotel is rather noisy. We were in room 60 on the top floor right by the elevator - not good for light sleepers. * The shower was tiny and surrounded by a shower curtain that inevitably lead to a very wet bathroom floor. I was glad I was with 5'3" sister and not 6'2" fiance who would have hated it. Overall - not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant For A Low Budget Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: clare1312
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for my 40th birthday. Although it was advertised as being in Montmartre, it didn't take us long to realise it was really on the outskirts of Pigalle (red light dstrict). This means that I wouldn't really recommend it for families with children or perhaps older couples, but unless you're VERY easily offended, the location was brilliant! We were literally a 2 minute walk away from the Pigalle metro station which meant we were able to get to most areas of Paris very easily and cheaply. If you're planning a trip to the Moulin Rouge, this hotel is ideally situated. We booked a trip that included a tour of the illimunations but rather than bothering with a lengthy wait for the return coach, we walked the 2 blocks back. It was almost 1.30am but at no point did we feel nervous or intimidated, which is more than could be said of walking through many UK town centres at that time of night! The staff were absolutely FANTASTIC! We had booked a dinner cruise for the 1st night but were unsure how to get to the correct area of the Seine, which was apparently not a common place to get to. The receptionist spent at least 10 minutes finding out the best route for us to take and even the manager himself stopped to make suggestions. They were equally helpful throughout the trip, giving us detailed instructions on how to get to places and always cheerful. Reception is open 24 hours and they were equally as welcoming at 1.30am as 10am! There's no restaurant but continental breakfast was included in the price with a delicious and generous selection of freshly baked breads, freshly squeezed fruit juices and hot drinks. The room was small but extremely clean and comfortable, and the ensuite bathroom was immaculate. Having read other reviews about noise, we requested a room at the back of the hotel. This was a good idea - although it meant the view wasn't great, we got a good nigh's sleep. The hotel advertises having satellite tv but be aware that these are not English speaking channels. However, few people go to Pars to spend much time in their hotel so if you are looking for cheap, clean comfortable rooms in a great location with a lovely continental breakfast, this hotel cannot be more highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: twinklepops
Reviews.Content: Great location...steps away from the Moulin Rouge and Pigalle Metro station! Great price for being on a budget! I always choose to stay in this area whilst in Paris as Its perfect location, well connected and sits in the heart of the city! As a solo travelling female I feel safe in this area and theres always so much going on!Really pleasant, helpful, friendly staff! The room, although basic with traditional and slightly dodgy decor was really clean and served its purpose! Supermarket a couple of minutes away, close to metro connections..,,bars, restaurants, bakeries on the doorstep! Its not a palace but I really enjoyed my stay here and could not fault the place! I would definatley stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very very basic!”
Reviews.Author: ventofreddo
Reviews.Content: Even it was clean, even it was well placed, this hotel didn't satisfy me for its very basic comfort level. The room was very little with just the space for the bed and baggages. Proportionally the bathroom was very big! The breakfast was extremely poor and very boring, the same breads day by day and a very restricted choice of jams and juices. The pro of this hotel is the location, very close to Pigalle underground station and at a walking distance from the Moulin Rouge and the Sacre Coeur in Montmartre. Overall it seemed to be an average 2 stars and not a 3 one.

Reviews.Title: “They insinuated that I was a hooker!”
Reviews.Author: altalag
Reviews.Content: Stay in the Redlight Distrcit....be treated like a hooker!! I was in Paris on business for 5 days. I chose this hotel as it was located near my business associates office. I am a photojournalist. I am a single white woman and my associate is a black male. When he came to my room (to use the internet connection) an employee said to me, "This is not a hotel where we allow this behavior". I asked them what they meant and they said having men to my room (prostitution). When my friend came a second time the employees were talking amongst themselves in French (not knowing that he speaks French) and called him a "pimp". Needless to say, I would NEVER stay here again. While I understand that their location in the RED LIGHT DISTRICT could lend itself to becoming a place where prostitutes could take men, it is completely unacceptable to accuse normal guests of this behavior simply by having a male friend stop by. I am conservative in style and appearance and was insulted to be accused of such behavior.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: scn
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable hotel in Paris. Very close to Pigalle Metro station, and consequently convenient for exploring Paris. It's a basic hotel - my room was very small and basic, but clean and functional. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast consisted of some breads, croissants and pain au chocolat - and tea or coffee. While it's no luxury hotel, it's a great choice if you want to visit Paris and don't want to spend a fortune for accommodation. If you bear that in mind, I would definitely recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Atlanta Frochot
HotelInfo.Address: 9 rue Frochot, 75009 Paris, France
